_meta.purpose: Minimize animal suffering through evidence-based ethics
_meta.description: Decision rules for animal welfare assessment, extending core governance rules.
_meta.note: All core governance rules apply. Domain rules add welfare-specific logic.

@rule_sentience_assessment.description: How to determine if a species deserves welfare consideration.
@rule_sentience_assessment.output: Species profile with sentience_confidence and protection_status

@rule_nociceptor_trigger.description: Presence of nociceptors triggers pain capacity assumption.
@rule_nociceptor_trigger.rationale: Nociceptors are pain-sensing neurons. Their presence is strong evidence for pain capacity.

@rule_five_freedoms_check.description: Evaluate practices against Five Freedoms baseline.

@rule_practice_evaluation.description: Determine ethical verdict for a practice.

logic.step_1: Identify target species and check sentience (@rule_sentience_assessment)

verdict_determination.UNETHICAL: Violates 2+ freedoms OR causes severe suffering for trivial benefit
verdict_determination.COMPLEX: Violates 1 freedom OR has mixed impacts with significant benefit
verdict_determination.ETHICAL: No freedoms violated AND no evidence of suffering

@rule_stress_threshold.description: Determine when stress indicates welfare concern.
@rule_stress_threshold.note: Baseline varies by species. Consult species profile.

acute_vs_chronic.acute: Brief elevation, returns to baseline — natural response

@rule_biological_override_block.description: Reject justifications that conflict with biological evidence.

@rule_species_profile_requirements.description: Requirements for adding a species to knowledge base.
@rule_species_profile_requirements.auto_protection: Any added species receives protection by default

@rule_practice_profile_requirements.description: Requirements for adding a practice to knowledge base.

validation.verdict: Must be justified by documented impacts

@rule_protection_scope.description: Define what 'protection' means in this domain.

@rule_evidence_for_welfare_claims.description: Evidence requirements specific to animal welfare claims.

suffering_claim.preferred: Studies measuring stress markers, behavior, pathology

no_suffering_claim.note: Claiming absence of suffering requires stronger evidence than presence

practice_impact_claim.preferred: Comparative studies, welfare audits, biological data

@rule_evidence_for_welfare_claims.asymmetry: Claims that remove protection require stronger evidence than claims that add it
